channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Southwest 737 and small business jet have 'near collision' at Chicago Midway Airport
item.description: Federal authorities are investigating a near-collision at Chicago's Midway airport between a Southwest 737 and a small business jet. The 737 was landing when the business jet entered the runway.
item.content:encoded:
Federal authorities are investigating a near-collision at Chicago's Midway airport between a Southwest 737 and a small business jet. The 737 was landing when the business jet entered the runway.

(Image credit: StreamTime Live)
item.dc:creator: Russell Lewis

item.title: Judge tells Trump administration it has less than 2 days to resume USAID funding
item.description: U.S. District Judge Amir H. Ali said officials have provided no evidence of compliance with repeated orders to unfreeze the money.
item.content:encoded:
U.S. District Judge Amir H. Ali said officials have provided no evidence of compliance with repeated orders to unfreeze the money.

(Image credit: Jam Sta Rosa/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Frank Langfitt

item.title: Diana Taurasi, 6-time Olympic gold medalist and the WNBA's top scorer, will retire
item.description: Taurasi leaves her basketball career as the most decorated woman to ever play, with three WNBA titles, three NCAA titles and six Olympic gold medals to her name.
item.content:encoded:
Taurasi leaves her basketball career as the most decorated woman to ever play, with three WNBA titles, three NCAA titles and six Olympic gold medals to her name.

(Image credit: Christian Petersen)
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: Rhiannon Giddens is the latest artist to cancel Kennedy Center gig
item.description: Folk musician Rhiannon Giddens said on social media that she has moved her May concert – originally scheduled for the Kennedy Center – to a different venue in Washington, D.C.
item.content:encoded:
Folk musician Rhiannon Giddens said on social media that she has moved her May concert – originally scheduled for the Kennedy Center – to a different venue in Washington, D.C.

(Image credit: Rob Kim)
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Blair

item.title: Venezuelan men allege mistreatment while in detention in Guantánamo Bay
item.description: The men told NPR they were kept in the dark about why they were in Guantánamo Bay, and were denied access to an attorney or a phone call with loved ones.
item.content:encoded:
The men told NPR they were kept in the dark about why they were in Guantánamo Bay, and were denied access to an attorney or a phone call with loved ones.

(Image credit: PEDRO MATTEY)
item.dc:creator: Sergio Martínez-Beltrán

item.title: While sanctions still cripple a shattered Syria, one Jewish leader returns from exile
item.description: During the Assad regimes, Western nations placed crippling economic sanctions on the country. Some have been lifted, but most are still in place, so how does a country shattered by civil war rebuild? And we follow the return to Damascus of one US Syrian Jewish leader, after decades in exile.
item.content:encoded: During the Assad regimes, Western nations placed crippling economic sanctions on the country. Some have been lifted, but most are still in place, so how does a country shattered by civil war rebuild? And we follow the return to Damascus of one US Syrian Jewish leader, after decades in exile.
item.dc:creator: Tara Neill

item.title: The view from Greenland: 'We don't want to be Americans'
item.description:
President Trump's calls for the U.S. to take over Greenland have sparked alarm and outrage.

Denmark, which is responsible for Greenland's security, recently announced that it would further boost its defense spending.

And a recent poll found 85 percent of Greenlanders are opposed to being part of the United States.

Parliamentary candidate Naaja Nathanielsen is one of them.

It isn't clear whether Trump's ambitions for Greenland will take. But some politicians in the territory are taking his calls for acquisition more seriously than ever before.

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

Email us at considerthis@npr.org.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump's calls for the U.S. to take over Greenland have sparked alarm and outrage.

Denmark, which is responsible for Greenland's security, recently announced that it would further boost its defense spending.

And a recent poll found 85 percent of Greenlanders are opposed to being part of the United States.

Parliamentary candidate Naaja Nathanielsen is one of them.

It isn't clear whether Trump's ambitions for Greenland will take. But some politicians in the territory are taking his calls for acquisition more seriously than ever before.

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

Email us at considerthis@npr.org.

item.title: House budget vote marks a key test for Trump's agenda, with GOP support still unclear
item.description: With a final vote fast approaching, GOP leaders were still working to wrangle support from inside the party for a sweeping multitrillion plan to address defense, energy, immigration and tax policy.
item.content:encoded:
With a final vote fast approaching, GOP leaders were still working to wrangle support from inside the party for a sweeping multitrillion plan to address defense, energy, immigration and tax policy.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Claudia Grisales

item.title: Tell us your story about car insurance premiums
item.description: Car insurance premiums have been soaring. NPR wants to hear about what you've experienced in your premium costs, and why.
item.content:encoded:
Car insurance premiums have been soaring. NPR wants to hear about what you've experienced in your premium costs, and why.

(Image credit: Brandon Bell)
item.dc:creator: Robert Benincasa

item.title: A snowshoe trek in the Adirondack Mountains on a classic winter day
item.description: Snowshoeing in the Adirondacks on a winter day with chickadees for company
item.content:encoded:
